alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk; Southeast Suffolk; Southern Nassau; Southwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued March 02 at 6:25PM EST until March 04 at 12:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...1 1/2 to 2 1/2 feet of inundation above ground level possible in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Northeast Suffolk, Southwest Suffolk, Southeast Suffolk and Southern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...From late Friday night through Saturday morning. * COASTAL IMPACTS...Widespread minor to moderate flooding of vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. Expect 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 feet of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. This will result in numerous road closures and cause widespread flooding of low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront. Vehicles parked in vulnerable areas near the waterfront will likely become flooded. Flooding will also extend inland from the waterfront along tidal rivers and bays. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 7 to 11 ft along the oceanfront will result in significant beach flooding and erosion. Scattered areas of dune base erosion is expected. The probability of washovers is low. Along the twin forks of Long Island, particularly Orient Point, breaking waves of 3 to 5 ft along open east and northeast facing shorelines will result in beach erosion, with wave splashover over dunes and bulkheads exacerbating flooding of shoreline roads and properties. Localized minor damage to shoreline structures is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The magnitude of coastal flooding will be heavily determined by the timing of winds shifting from the east to the northeast in relation to the time of high tide Saturday morning. At this point, this windshift is expected to occur right around the time of high tide. An earlier windshift would result in water levels falling to the low end of the forecast range, while a later windshift would result in water levels rising to on the high end of the forecast range. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. PECONIC RIVER AT RIVERHEAD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.6 FT, MODERATE 6.3 FT, MAJOR 7.1 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.2 FT, MODERATE 2.9 FT, MAJOR 3.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 02/09 PM 3.2/ 3.7 -0.2/ 0.2 0.8/ 1.3 1 NONE 03/09 AM 4.0/ 4.5 0.6/ 1.1 1.0/ 1.5 0 NONE 03/10 PM 4.0/ 4.5 0.6/ 1.1 1.5/ 2.0 1 NONE 04/10 AM 6.6/ 7.1 3.2/ 3.7 3.6/ 4.1 0-2 MODERATE 04/10 PM 4.2/ 4.7 0.8/ 1.3 1.6/ 2.0 1 NONE 05/10 AM 4.4/ 4.9 1.0/ 1.5 1.5/ 2.0 1 NONE ORIENT HARBOR AT ORIENT POINT NY MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Suffolk; Southeast Suffolk; Southern Nassau; Southwest Suffolk
